intro: Prangos peucedanifolia, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in horticulture.
